Reviews.Title: “Very good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Zuzana C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. It is located near famous shopping mall KaDeWe and shopping street KurfürsterDamm, very close to the town center - sightseeing, main station (Hauptbahnhof) - 10 minutes by S-Bahn/U-Bahn from Wittenbergplatz. The whole hotel and room was clean, tidy and cozy, which is the most important, I think. Cleaning service was great. The equipment is visibly getting old but it has some atmosphere (beside lightly cracked basin and scratch toilet). Breakfasts (open buffet) were good, enough of everything but we had to order tea or coffee extra at a waitress. What we did not really like was the fact that wi-fi was not free of charge, but 7 EUR a day. During our stay it was not available to pay by card. Reception was open 24 hours a day, which was fine – some of receptionists were nicer, other less. It was a nice stay for 3 nights but if we wanted to stay longer next time we would probably choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ageing a little but comfortable and well placed”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Located in the ex-house of Freuds sister this hotel has a modern reception but is looking a little worn within. That being said it is still smart and has beautiful touches such as the carved wolfs head banisters at the base of the main stairs. Staff were very friendly and the breakfast is excellant. Located a few minutes from either the Zoo or Witgenbergplatz U-bahn stations it has excellant transport connections (the Wittgenbergplatz station is also beautiful). Also close tot he main west Berlin shopping areas, KaDeWe department store and Thermen spa. I have stayed here five times now for both business and pleasure and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of air in Air in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Tuula K
Reviews.Content: My room was surely the smallest and poorest in the Hotel. In the brochure they showed nice looking rooms, but I think it is the fate of a solo traveller to get the worst room. I felt I couldn't breath in the room, so I had to keep my window open during the whole nights, though it was chilly in the night, because it was only just springtime. The bathroom looked as it had been recently renovated, so plus for that and for the mini-bar. The breakfast was nothing special, the juice and the yoghurt tasted artificial and the coffee could have been stronger. The location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Air in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: greenL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Air in Berlin for a business conference. The hotel is not posh, but had a friendly and clean atmosphere, with some beautiful architectural features on the upper floors. My first room on the ground floor was OK, but couldn't get a wifi connection. The manager kindly offered me another room on the third floor, which was very spacious and clean, and good wifi reception. They offer a nice breakfast in the morning, and there is a small bar area for gathering in the evening. The hotel is just a few blocks from the Zoo station - easy access to airport buses, train and underground.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: DanyJames
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nothing fancy, very clean, warm room (stayed in December) and similar size to most European city hotels, comfortable bed, adequate shower with plenty of hot water and everything worked without leaks. Staff courteous but not overly friendly, breakfast expensive for what there is but a coffee shop on Ku'Dam had excellent pastries, muffins, sandwiches, and breads plus great coffee and it was literally a four minute walk so while my wife showered I went out for breakfast to go. All transportation (U-bahn, bus, rail) is within two blocks as is the Zoo train station, zoo, aquarium, KaDeWe, Karstadt, and a tremendous selection of restaurants from touristy to quaint local serving very good food. We have stayed at this hotel three times out of five trips to Berlin in the last eight years and find it meets all our needs. There are fancier places, but we go to Berlin for the city, the people, the culture and events, the history that exists here. It is one of our favorite destinations and we usually visit during the fall/winter season so as to avoid the tourist hordes and take advantage of the Christmas events and markets. Don't miss Treptow Park, an emotional experience and not usually found on the "do not miss" lists in the guide books.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: janao
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this location 6 years ago. It was solely chosen because of location and price. Location is brilliant! Stayed there for New Years eve, and I walked from the hotel to the big New Years party in Berlin. Stayed in room 18 (first floor); a superior single room. The room itself is ok. Nothing special, but not bad either. Clean. The pillows could be better and the bed was somewhat wiggly. This is the first hotel room I have stayed in that had enough electrical outlets! Did not try the breakfast because there are 3-4 places within 200 meters with serves breakfast. The hotel itself does not provide internet access, but there are one available, but I never managed to connect to it from room 18. But used free Wifi in the morning where I ate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/Average Hotel/Good Service”
Reviews.Author: DaydreamerAmersfoort
Reviews.Content: We drove by car to this hotel. It was easy to be found and they had a good carparking behind the hotel which cost us only 4 euros a day. the hotel was jugendstil fashioned. The service at the hotel was good. The hotelroom was ok, it had everything we needed to sleep well. The beds where ok not super but ok, the bathroom was good, the tv was very small but we didn't look much tv ;-). The breakfast was ok, also not super but ok. What we really liked was that it was just 2 minutes away from the u-bahn so we were travelling Berlin very fast leaving the hotel and that made our stay very comfortable in a hotel that has everything for a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mangelhaft”
Reviews.Author: dickdekker
Reviews.Content: I expected more from what I red about the hotel....entrance and bar very poor and small. Staff a lot of smoking outsite the door which was bad in my opinion. The lift entrance outsite I find a minus. It was a clean hotel that is a plus and breakfast and the situation in Berlin very good.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Markets in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Coos O
Reviews.Content: Party of 4 (2 x 2) to visit the Christmas Markets in Berlin and to see the city. Came by car which could be very conveniently parked (at a reasonable price) at the back of the hotel. Rooms were all-right; clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good, staff was very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our stay in Berlin and can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Great Staff,Great Budget Value”
Reviews.Author: Udney P
Reviews.Content: Grand old home, now a hotel, beautiful exterior and simple rooms for a great price (EUR55 for basic single)

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL IN CENTRAL BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four days this summer and found it to be very good, It's in the central of Berlin close to KaDeWe and and the rest of west Berlin. Very good staff and clean nice room. I will stay here again when in Berlin!! Nothing to complain about!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Air in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Skye00
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel as part of a city break. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was basic but all we needed as we were sightseeing all day. Very clean, warm and comfortable. Good breakfast with choice of cold meat, cheese etc., plus yoghurt and fruit. Fantastic location. Near U-Bahn, plenty of restaurants within walking distance, and near legendary store KeDeWe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mohammedbaza
Reviews.Content: Very dutiful old heritage hotel, located in the center and it is just view meters from the famous KDW shopping center. Underground station is just very near. The hotel has very large rooms appropriate for big families, it offer excellent breakfast through a friendly staff of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “First appearances can be wrong...”
Reviews.Author: Jempie
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi from the airport, saw that the driver had to search and were not happily surprised upon arrival. The hotel entrance looks like an (open) garage box; with a long bar going deep inside. Which goes to show that first appearances are not always true... Originally, this building must have housed really chique appartments (the authentic front doors on every floor are nicely restaured & incorporated), and the rooms are installed with German effectiveness. We could have used some airco (Berlin can be very hot) though, and the shower was too primitive as well (just a curtain around it). But the hotel is really close to Kurfurstendam, just 100 metres away from KaDeWe. And we slept well...

Reviews.Title: “It was fine.”
Reviews.Author: laura_12223
Reviews.Content: There's not too much to really say about Hotel Air Berlin. It's fine, particularly for the price. The staff were friendly enough. It was relatively clean but again, we couldn't really complain, for the price that we paid. It was a short walk to the U-Bahn, which was convenient and there's quite a few nice restaurants in the area, as well. Stay here if you are on a budget and you don't really mind where you sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cinti687
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week for business and found this hotel very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and each person made sure all requests were met. The check out was easy too. Breakfast was delicious but if you do not each much there is a wonderful bakery/coffee place just a short walk around the block. The location of this hotel is perfect to the bus line to many sights and easy walking to the Europa Center and access to the U-Bahn and big shopping at KeDaWe.

Reviews.Title: “Safe area for the solo female traveller.”
Reviews.Author: wardens186337
Reviews.Content: Excellent four day trip, Brilliant location.Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Gave excellent advice on the tourist trips and locations. Excellent breakfast. Bathroon on the small side, shower easy to regulate and spotless, nice white fluffy towels. One note of caution the frayed carpets on the stairs need a bit of attention. ENJOY....

Reviews.Title: “clean friendly hotel excellent location for sights and sounds”
Reviews.Author: thepitchpit Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel located only 10 mins walk from the local station (zoological gardens) and near the tube as well. Near the Zoo, Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag. You can then get a tour bus from the gate to see other sights such as Checkpoint Charlie. The breakfast in the hotel is very good offering cereal, meats and cheeses, breads, jams and eggs to get your day going well. Rooms are basic but very functional as a base for sightseeing with tv and radio. Liked the power shower in the bathroom. It even had a hairdryer. Ideal for shopping lots of souviner shops near by. There are plenty of places to eat near by or near the station where you can have fish and chips, chinese, pizza, as well as german brockwurst!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: talbinus
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel that provides a clean, comfortable sleeping room for a very reasonable price. I have stayed at the hotel many times and intend to stay there many more times. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. The location is great. It is convenient to Tegel airport, bus routes and the U and S bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jinnty_jmcd Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a great location. It is not too far from the main shopping area but far enough away from the noise of traffic. Our only small gripe if you wish to call it that was that we had booked two double rooms. Yes we got them but they were not equal, we had one double, small but clean and adquate and one huge double family room, it had two double bedrooms which were huge. So we all stayed in the large "suite" and handed back the key to the other room. I loved the breakfast which more than suited us.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Ideal for Sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Kristy28
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location although there is not a lot of good quality restaurants around the hotel although there is a pizza hut close by. We had a triple room which had a small hallway with a door to the bathroom, the main part of the room with two beds, a wardrobe and tv in it and then another little room with a bed, tv and wardrobe in it which was perfect situation for us. The rooms were cleaned daily. The underground station is under five minutes away so you can easily go out around Berlin. It does not take too long getting to the sites like the Reichstag, Brandenburg gate and the Tiergarten on the underground as they are all close together. The Kaiser Wilhem church and the zoo are nearby beside a lot of shops in Kurfürsten-damm and a stop for the Berlin bus tour which you can buy a ticket for and get on and off at various stops around Berlin, with it stopping near the German history museum, Berlin Catherdral, the TV tower, the Holocaust memorial, Checkpoint Charlie and before it reachs the Checkpoint you drive past a remaining part of the Berlin Wall. A wonderful hotel if you are intrested and seeing many sites of Berlin and i would recommend trying to see a lot of them as many are very beautiful and intresting. Also following the path of the Berlin Wall is a good activity to do as it is marked on the ground and is fairly easy to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GCaceres
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and cost, small improvements for breakfast and overall hotel technology would make this perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Worn-out hotel with a bad location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn1980
Reviews.Content: If you're a young person and into Berlin, you'll very fast notice that most of the interesting things are in East Berlin, not West Berlin (except for districts like Kreuzberg and maybe Neukölln). That's the biggest problem with this hotel – it's located in the heart of West Berlin. So you always have to spend 30 minutes taking the train or the subway to the East. Of course there's things to do in West as well, like shopping and some attractions, but it's not very interesting neighborhood (and not 'hip' at all). The other problem is that although the lobby and the pics look nice, the rooms are small-ish and old, without modern conveniences such as air conditioning. Or wi-fi. And if it's so hot that you need to keep the windows open, the noise from the street is quite overwhelming. I'm sure this was a great place back in the days when the Germanies (and Berlin) still were divided, but nowadays: not recommended. People telling you it's a great location don't know the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: fpickering
Reviews.Content: Was a little unsure after reading the various reviews on trip advisor. The hotel was great, room was a small but very clean but only used this for sleeping as out all day and night. Breakfast area bit tight in the morning but we used upstairs tables so did not have a problem with this. Was looking for a central location for the Xmas Markets and this was ideal, would suggest if anyone going before the Xmas, print off list of markets so you can then travel on the tubes very easily. Just around the corner we found a 24hr bar which was handy!! Would also suggest you go to the Irish Bar as this was very lively. Overall a great location and would go back to this hotel. Would advice comfy shoes due to alot of walking about!!

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: MickandSusanC
Reviews.Content: After I had booked the Hotel, I had seen some bad reviews on the internet so I had some concerns ! However, these were unfounded as the room was very nice, and clean. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, and the location could not be better for sightseeing and shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Senior60+
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this hotel for five nights in late May, 2008. There are at least two positive things to say about it: location and value. As others have reviewed, it is in a great location - close to Wittenbergplatz where you can find a popular U-Bahn stop, trams and busses. The KaDaWe department store located there is worth a half-day tour. Be sure to check out the food floor. The other positive thing, value, was important to us. Our rate was 104 Euros for one night and 83 Euros for the other four nights. I never did figure out why there was a difference but I knew about it when I reserved the room. Of course, when there is "value", there are tradeoffs. Here are some important to us. The room was tiny. The bathroom was cramped. There was no elevator to our room on the first floor (second floor in U.S. terminology). The staff was very young and spoke only broken English. This was not a problem for basic information exchange but they were absolutely no help regarding local attractions or locating other things such as an Internet cafe. (It turns out that there is one two blocks away! Go to the KFC and look across the street.) Our traveling companions said there was no wi-fi for their laptop. The breakfast was nine Euros per person and was not as good as free breakfasts at other places we stayed, so we only ate there one morning. You will not find amenities here that you find at larger hotels. Having said all this, I come back to value and location. We consider these to be important so, overall, we were satisfied. I do not know if this hotel has air conditioned rooms so check on this if it's going to be hot when you travel. The ventilation was not great. For breakfast, try the coffee shop diagonally across Wittenbergplatz. I can't remember its name but it's the one that sells ice cream as well as coffee, pastries, breakfast, etc.. It's very nice inside. There is also a supermarket on Wittenbergplatz. There is a laundry a few doors from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is main selling point”
Reviews.Author: Noelsguitar
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic and probably worth staying for that reason alone. The price for this location compared well with others in the area. The staff very friendly and efficient I have to say. And the whole hotel was very very clean. On the downside, room was tiny, and I mean tiny. Ours was meant to be "superior" but we spent the whole stay wondering what we got for the extra 10.00 per night. It seemed exactly the same as our friends' standard room! Bathroom was spacious however and again, very clean. Breakfast was the main problem for us, not the food, that was ok, just the amount of space for so many guests. There were only 10 tables for whole hotel and so we had to eat very late (10.00) on both days due to not having anywhere to sit. This hotel really is no frills. Its a good price for somewhere to lay your head right on hand for the K'u Dam etc. I would recommend it with all of that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t expect a good holiday”
Reviews.Author: HarriethSweden
Reviews.Content: We were four persons staying at the hotel for two nights. We had booked well in advance, about 45 days before arrival and one couple got a fairly spacious room on the third floor, whereas the other two got a horrible little room on the first floor. The room plan was very strange with a narrow corridor holding a desk and a chair and then you had to turn right 180 degrees to find another narrow space with two beds. The only good thing to say about this arrrangement was that the beds were comfortable and wide. The bathroom in the first narrow corridor of the room was also good. The worst thing was a window without any curtains in the first corridor of the room.. When you stepped into or out of the bathroom EVERYBODY across the yard could watch you. Imagine the feeling if you had taken a shower and were undressed! This we pointed out to the receptionist but to no avail. Finally we had to cover up the window with one of the bath towels to get some privacy. Unprofessional staff-warning! Stay out of this hotel if you want to enjoy your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: phoebe_skywalker
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for 3 nights through [----] and got a good rate however I was very disappointed with this hotel. The first single room they put me in was slightly larger then a broom closet and the cleanliness was not up to the usually excellent German standard as there were hairs on the bathroom floor. I would have been able to get used to the small space, but what made it unbearable was the smell coming from the bathroom drains which I think must be a sewage problem. I had to sleep with the window open all night. (I went in Feb so it was cold!) The next day I asked the manager to be moved to a different room and she said all they had was another single, the same size. I offered to pay more for a better room but she said there weren't any other rooms. The single room she gave me was again very small but thankfully the bathroom did not have the strange sewage smell. However, it was a smoking room. (I had specifically asked for a non-smoking room when I booked) So, my choice was smoke or sewage smell! I chose the smoking room and had to sleep with the window open. (again) The manager could have easily fixed this situation but chose not to. (there WERE other rooms available, I had a friend ring them and she said there were doubles) Because I had paid a low price for the room she was not willing to help. Despite all this I had a wonderful time in Berlin but I would not use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with prime location”
Reviews.Author: Elijahhawaii
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be typical of its rating. No big surprises. The best thing about this hotel IS the location. It is only 1/2 a block away from a main street, subway stop, and the KaDeWe department store, but it is quiet. Yes the breakfast is typical rolls, cheese, and meats but then again, with KaDeWe and its prime selection of foods, just let this hotel be your appetizer for bigger and better things. the room I stayed in was small compared to American hotel rooms. However, this IS Europe. Most are small according to American tastes, and therefore I was very happy with it. It was cozy and inviting overall, including the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt_21_Bristol
Reviews.Content: I felt this hotel was a really good place to stay. Its in an excellent location, really near the (Alexanderplatz?) metro station but remarkably quiet too. We found this a really good place to explore Berlin from, as it was so easy to get about. Plus the local area seemed very pleasant, with restaurants and bars not too far away. There was also a huge department store called Ka Da We about 5 minutes down the road and a cheap supermarket about 2 minutes walk away which was really useful for getting supplies. The hotel itself is in a really interesting building, with nice wide corridors and seemingly plenty of rooms, furnished/decorated well. The rooms were nice and clean and of a reasonable size, though I guess it depends what you're used to - For us as a couple it was ideal. Plus, the double glazing blocks out any sound and the beds were fairly large and comfortable, so you'll be sure of a good nights sleep! The breakfast was very pleasant, held in the modern looking bar and reception area downstairs. Admittedly, the reception desk is close by but this wasn't at all unpleasant or disturbing - We had a lovely breakfast every morning for the 5 days of our stay. Staff were all very polite and friendly, willing to answer questions about how to get somewhere or what to see. Price-wise it was just right I think.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say, but not as good”
Reviews.Author: JE-Whatever
Reviews.Content: I was booked into Hotel Air for a conference. They put me in a single room. The single rooms are VERY SMALL (mine was #205). Now, in their defense, I'll say that I got used to the room within a day or so, all I did there was sleep, clean myself and call my spouse back home, and that the bed was comfortable enough. But still, if you are an American used to having some room in your room, the singles will be a bit of a shock. The location is outstanding for getting to the U-bahn and seeing town and there are some good restaurants within walking distance (at least east, south, west). There is an internet cafe one block over but the staff don't appear to know about it. Don't consume the overpriced goodies in the room. There is a "kaiser's" within a block where you can get what you need. I even took the liberty of emptying the silly stuff they put in the fridge and replacing it with my own water. The maid didn't seem to mind. Breakfast isn't elaborate but it also isn't terrible. I'd call it functional. I certainly thought it was good enough not to go looking somewhere else. For the most part the staff speaks a little English (don't expect too much though) and is polite, but on the night shift they clearly had someone on her first night, who knew no English and couldn't manage the phone to forward calls. It took several tries for my spouse to get through to my room. If I were traveling to Berlin for a vacation, the first thing I'd do is check the reviews here and then I'd probably try another place. If you don't mind small spaces and can get a good rate, then this place is probably worth a look. One last thing. Unless there are ground floor rooms (which I didn't see) this hotel IS NOT handicapped accessible. I took the elevator when I arrived thinking it would save me lugging my bags. It stops inbetween floors and then you have to walk stairs.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: oldexplorer
Reviews.Content: WE enjoyed the location, large rooms, nice atmosphere,ample breakfast in comfortable room, and quiet of this hotel. We were disappointed to find our rooms were not very clean. Large dust bunnies and webs hung from the ceiling and the rug was stained. Beds, and furniture were fine.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAndrews
Reviews.Content: This is a nice reasonably priced hotel located about 10 minutes from the Zoo station. The hotel is ideally situated for seeing the major sites and it is in a very quiet location just off of the Kurfurstendamm. nearby there is an abundance of major stores, beer gardens, restauraunts and other places to eat. The hotel was very clean and tidy and the rooms were very large, The breakfast area looks as though it has been revamped and has ample seating. The breakfast was more than adequate and very nice. I didn`t find the reception staff overly helpful, but it wouldnt put me off using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The room was very large, so was the bathroom, and, as often in Germany, really clean and nice. Also, this hotel has the BEST location, in a quiet street just next to Kurfurstendamm. Right next to the hotel there were supermarkets, restaurants, beer gartens, it was exellent! We also found this hotel was really good value, no luxury, but not bad either. Our only complaint is the breakfast, it was a bit boring, and the breakfastroom was really crowded, so we had to wait to be seated every day! But at least the breakfast was included in the price.. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, and we would choose this hotel again if we ever go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value weekend break”
Reviews.Author: pete64
Reviews.Content: When we stayed, they did a special weekend rate of 85 euros pp for three nights including breakfast arriving on Friday and leaving on Monday which offered good value for money. We had a spacious and well equipped fourth floor bedroom at the quiet back of the hotel. Only downside is that the breakfast area can get congested at peak times. Good location in a quiet area and convenient for buses and trains. Just 200m from both KaDeWe store and the tourist office in the Europa Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Air in Berlin - good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Modest, comfortable small hotel at a summer special rate of 80 Euro, B & B. We had an excellent ground floor room but didn't see any elevator in the lobby - worth checking. It's a few minutes walk from the 'centre' of west Berlin - Breitscheidplatz, Zoo'garden station and the Kurfurstendamm. Get a No.100 bus from there and see all the major sights, right up to the far end of Unter den Linden and back, for little more than a tenth of the cost of one of the 'guided tour' buses.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Air in Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Ansbacherstrasse 6, 10787 Berlin, Germany
